fields.description:
When using the german locale of JIRA the Names of the Status in the Change History are not internationalised and are still displayed in english.

This bug can be reproduced on our JIRA installations as well as on jira.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Status is not internationalised in the issue's Change History

fields.description:
There's a couple of places in JIRA where we leak (or could potentially leak) the VelocityEngine directly or indirectly via the WW-ActionContext threadlocal.

These are:
* WebWorkAdaptor.mapJellyTagToAction (finalizeContext should be in finally block)
* JiraPluginWebworkVelocityServlet (static declaration of VelocityManager)
* SearchContextImpl.GLOBAL_SEARCH_CONTEXT may hold on to VelocityManagers (via several links)
* QuickLinkServlet: locally caches several managers that may hold on to the VelocityManager/Engine.
fields.summary: JIRA leaks instances of the VelocityEngine in several places

fields.description:
The Issue XML view has the header:
{code:xml}
<rss version="0.92">
<channel>
    <title>#esc($title)</title>
    <link>#esc($requestContext.baseUrl)</link>
    <description>This file is an XML representation of an issue</description>
    <language>en</language>
{code}
The description should be internationalised, however we will need to investigate its side-effects. Need to ensure it does not break RSS/XML standard and whether we need to change the language tag in the header as well.
fields.summary: Translate Issue XML view header

fields.description:
Ran the integrity checker.
The "Preview" screen showed 3 areas that needed attention.
I clicked the "Fix these errors" button, and after a few minutes the next screen came up, saying "No errors were corrected".
fields.summary: Integrity checker fixes errors, then says "no errors were corrected"

fields.description:
"Choose the errors you would like to correct, or return to the pevious screen."
should say "previous" not "pevious"
fields.summary: Typo on Integrity Checker preview screen
NOTIFICATIONS - need to notification schemes at the issue type level

fields.description: Need ability to change project component field type from multi select to single select.  We only want the user to be able to select one component per record.
fields.summary: Need ability to change project component field type from multi select to single select

fields.description:
Add positive int as a data type (numeric just isn't cutting it in some cases).
Also, would be nice if you could set the max. value allowed, so it could be set to something smaller than the default 100,000,000,000,000.
fields.summary: Add int as custom data field & allow max to be specified

fields.description:
Click on Administration --> Click Project --> Select a Project --->  Project Role: View Members --> Edit a Role.

This is when there is a null pointer exception,  I will attach the screen in later comments.
It seems that the application is trying to write to root /velocity.log file, which is not the case. 

Someone in support gave me a classpath.jsp to find out which velocity.properties was being used. This was of no help since I think it produced wrong output, and also provides misleading information about the actual velocity.properties being used.

We have tried everything from moving around velocity.properties to put in explicitly in classpath. Nothing works. This is a bug

Below is the stack trace

fields.description:
Select Release Notes of a project and the issue type headers of the notes are displayed in English only.
This is because the the name translation is not retireved from the IssueType object.
fields.summary: issue type headers of release notes is not translated

The two offending tooltips are: '{{Private Filter}}' and '{{Shared Filter}}'

Tooltip for percentage bar in browse projects roadmap panel is not i18n'ed.

fields.summary: Tooltip for percentage bar in browse projects roadmap panel is not i18n'ed

fields.description:
Mail clients like Thunderbird will break long attachment names up into multiple short lines, as per [RFC 2231|http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2231.html]:

Content-Type: application/pdf;
 name*0="alreallyreallyreallylongfilenamewithlogsoftextthatshouldlinewrap";
 name*1=".pdf"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Disposition: inline;
 filename*0="alreallyreallyreallylongfilenamewithlogsoftextthatshouldline";
 filename*1="wrap.pdf"

Unfortunately JavaMail (as of 1.4) [does not support this aspect of RFC 2231|http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jspa?forumID=43&threadID=783009]. JIRA will fail to add the attachment, and in the logs prints something like:

2007-04-11 17:48:28,604 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] part=javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart@13cd5b5
2007-04-11 17:48:28,605 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] Filename=null, content type=application/pdf;^M
 name*0="alreallyreallyreallylongfilenamewithlogsoftextthatshouldlinewrap";^M
 name*1=".pdf", content=com.sun.mail.util.BASE64DecoderStream@f27b6e
2007-04-11 17:48:28,605 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=tempattach34617dat).
2007-04-11 17:48:28,605 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] Encountered an error creating the attachment null for issue TP-39
2007-04-11 17:48:28,605 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 DEBUG [service.services.mail.MailFetcherService] Deleting Message: <461C92BC.1030609@atlassian.com>


JavaMail may also to even parse the email, and can die with:

{noformat}
2007-04-11 17:50:28,128 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-1 ERROR [service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler] Could not create issue!
javax.mail.internet.ParseException: Missing charset in encoded value: %61%6C%6C%79%6C%6F%6E%67%66%69%6C%65%6E%61%6D%65%77%69%74%68
    at javax.mail.internet.ParameterList.decodeValue(ParameterList.java:385)
    at javax.mail.internet.ParameterList.<init>(ParameterList.java:175)
    at javax.mail.internet.ContentDisposition.<init>(ContentDisposition.java:87)
    at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getDisposition(MimeBodyPart.java:1039)
    at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getDisposition(MimeBodyPart.java:299)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.saveAttachment(AbstractMessageHandler.java:311)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMultipart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:295)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentsForMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:243)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler.handleMessage(CreateIssueHandler.java:202)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:115)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:190)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
    at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
    at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
{noformat}

In this case, the mail is left in the queue, and you will see these stacktraces repeated in the logs every time the mail service triggers (usu. once a minute).
fields.summary: JIRA fails to add attachments with long filenames from RFC 2231-compliant mail clients

fields.description:
At the moment this field tries to be really smart during the creation of the createHtml and editHtml.  These methods are pretty much unusable for displaying the issueTypeSystemField anywhere else.

Ran into this during Issue to sub-task conversion when I needed to display a list of Issue Types from the same project.  Resorted to manually creating select list.

Some problems - 
* The way it decides whether it is a sub task
* The way it gets its options
* The html created expects a parent issue type field
fields.summary: Clean up createHtml/editHtml code for IssueTypeSystemField

fields.description:
In 3.7.x, if an email is processed which has an attachment, and the attachment's filename contains invalid characters that can't be represented on the JIRA filesystem, then JIRA will renames the file:

!jira373_bugscreenshot.png!

The problem here is that neither JIRA nor the user can now infer the type of the file. It could be a PDF, an image.. anything.

Rather than rename the whole file, JIRA should break filenames into name + extension, and sanitize each individually. Typically this will result in the extension being unharmed, yielding filenames like renamedFile~1.pdf.
fields.summary: Renamed email attachments lose extension

fields.description:
As described in the comment:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Feedback+for+DHTML-loading+of+Issue+screens?focusedCommentId=38797319#comment-38797319

Insert-Focus is not on first field in screen.

When I "Log Work done" to an Issue:

without DHTML-loading the Focus is in the Field " Time Spent:"

with DHTML-loading turned on, the Focus is "nowhere" (most outer frame)
fields.summary: DHTML issue operations break focus on first field in forms

fields.description:
"Responsable" is a custom project role in our application.
A global administrator of jira cannot remove an user in the dialog "Assign Users to Project Role: responsable". 
You get the error: You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role.
Thank's for your help,
Anne
fields.summary: Can't remove an user from a custom project role
Allow collapsing of versions in roadmap

fields.description:
This is probably related to changes made for JRA-10825.  When attaching a file (a PDF) containing chinese characters in the name, JIRA fails to add the attachment to the mentioned issue.

[Attached|^stdout.log] is the log (with -Dmail.debug=true) from parsing a mail with attached file with name 山手学院中学校 合格!.pdf:

2007-04-10 15:56:11,993 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 DEBUG [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] part=javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart@1cb2dd1
2007-04-10 15:56:11,993 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 DEBUG [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] Filename=null, content type=application/pdf, content=com.sun.mail.util.BASE64DecoderStream@2d150f
2007-04-10 15:56:11,993 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=tempattach52584dat).
2007-04-10 15:56:11,993 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 DEBUG [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] Encountered an error creating the attachment null for issue TP-13
fields.summary: Emails containing attachments with non-ASCII names lost

fields.description:
We've currently got a problem, where Tomcat seems to be running out of heap space, when running JIRAs functional tests. 

About a week ago, this test started failing with OutOfMemory errors.  I realize that increasing the maximum memory will probably get rid of this problem, but we've never had problems running the func tests with 256MB in the past, and we want to make sure we haven't introduced a memory leak. We examined the heapdump produced, and it looks like a large amount of the memory is retained by the org.apache.jasper.compiler.JspRuntimeContext (138 MB to be exact).

It seems that the 'jsps' SynchronizedMap is taking up all the space.  The problem does NOT occur on Java 1.6.

Need to investigate if it is normal behavior for the JspRuntimeContext to take up this much memory?
fields.summary: OutOfMemory error when running the functional tests on Tomcat 5.5.20 on JDK 1.5
Creating RemoteComment bug

fields.description:
After doing a clean install of AccuRev and JIRA (both independently work perfectly), I wanted to get them "linked" using AccuBridge for JIRA ( http://www.accurev.com/accubridge-jira.html ).  I followed their install instructions exactly, and encountered errors when trying to run "Step 18 Test the AIS for JIRA Configuration" of ais4jira_quick.pdf (attached)

The actuall error was:

2007-04-07@18:07:38 :: *** Invalid JIRA IssueNavigator response data:
2007-04-07@18:07:38 :: ***   XML Parser Error: 
syntax error at line 1, column 0, byte 0 at C:/Perl/lib/XML/Parser.pm line 187

2007-04-07@18:07:38 :: ***   Error detected when running the filter.

I believe those errors have to do with some breaking change in JIRA since the last time the integration with AccuRev was tested.  Specifically, everything in AccuBridge's instructions worked fine up to "Step 16 Customize configuration file JiraFilters.xml", where what the instructions showed as "Example" was nothing like I was seeing with JIRA 3.8.  As such I could not obtain the correct value for "filterOptions" and had to resort to looking inside the SQL tables to extract values for the "pid" field associated with the project I wanted to integrate.

In short - I believe Step 16 in the instructions is no longer compatible with the newest versions of JIRA.
fields.summary: AccuRev integration errors
Plugin Guide for Issue Views

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12514].
  {panel}

I want to notify some users (watchers, for example) about all comments, but not about all events.

If watchers are subscribers only to "Issue Commented" event, then watchers won't be notified about comment made when issue is reassigned with comment, for example.

If watchers are subscribed to all events where comments are possible, then watchers will be notified about all events even without comment, for example about all field value changes.

It would be great if users subcribed to "Issue Commented", received notifications about all events with non-empty comments.

Don't know how to easily hack that. Voted +1 for JRA-8743.
fields.summary: User should be notified about all events with non-empty comments when user is subscribed to "Issue commented" event

fields.description: If you look at http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/JTOOL-20 you'll see where some code has been added to create a custom notification type.  Unfortunately you also have to modify notification-event-types.xml in order for it to show up on the Notification Type management screen.  It would be useful if plugins could define their notification types and register or have them discovered so that they could be added to this list.
fields.summary: Allow NotificationType objects to be registered dynamically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12512].
  {panel}

We are using several tabs in our issue screens to organize issue fields.

Our users (talented and experienced engineers) are having difficulties to quickly identify that such links are providing access to additional fields that need to be filled during the workflow steps.
Either they can't find the information they are looking for, or this is slowing down issue creation as that's after mandatory checkings that they have to filled to missing fields in other tabs.

I have highlighted in the attached screenshot an example of the concerned area.

The request is to:
. Improve the default look&feel of these tabs so that they better look like tabs, especially for the issue fields, instead of regular links
. Offer the ability to customize the colors of such tabs (like done for other parts of the GUI), to let customers do some minimum color customization, in a standard way.

I noticed that no explicit CSS style was used on that part of the interface. Using appropriate CSS tags would be a first step to help customization.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Look&Feel Improvement & Customization for Screen tabs

fields.description:
A customer has requested the ability to specify the reporter when logging a Support Request through JIRA's built in problem reporting system. This could be achieved by having a field for identifying a previously created SAC reporter on the JiraSupportRequest page (e.g. username or email address). 

At the moment we appear to use JIRA's From address as specified in the default mail server which, as in the case below, isn't always a good thing:

{quote}
The really brilliant "Support Request" feature

http://jira/secure/admin/jira/JiraSupportRequest!default.jspa

Doesn't allow you to specify a specific support account, instead an account name is created based on a fake email address:

Username: jira@teligent.se
Email: jira@teligent.se
Full Name: jira@teligent.se
Password: 4u128b

This account generates a notification which is sent to this nonexisting email address, which luckily ended up with IT or would otherwise have been lost.

I see now that Jira has been configured with jira@teligent.se as the From address, normally that would be noreply@teligent.se which wouldn't help...

Instead we would like these support requests to be registered on "this" user, called "teligent" since we already haev this account and everyone knows about it...
{quote}
fields.summary: Add ability to specify reporter for JiraSupportRequest

fields.description:
We have had a fair few customers wanting to know what do they have to do when moving their JIRA instance to another server.
Since Upgrading JIRA follows some of the correct guidelines maybe we should update that page to include the instructions on what and how to move a JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Docs: Incorporate Move to New Server

fields.description: When logging work time, if the user does not enter a specific qualifier like h, d, etc..., then it defaults to minutes.  The default is poor in many cases.  Almost all of the time entered by our users is in hours.  We need a mechanism to specify the default time period so we can change in to hours.  Ideally, this could be done in the UI, but it would be sufficient for us to be able to configure it in the jira-application.properties file.
fields.summary: Log work entry default time period should be configurable

fields.description:
Lehman Brothers are developing an application which uses jira REST styled service to download jira RSS feed and parse it. However, we find the RSS feed having invalid XML characters in some of the queries, which causes the xml parser to fail. We see the following exception in log when we try to parse xml:

org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Character reference "&#1a" is an invalid XML character.
at weblogic.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1189)
at weblogic.xml.jaxp.WebLogicXMLReader.parse(WebLogicXMLReader.java:135)
at weblogic.xml.jaxp.RegistryXMLReader.parse(RegistryXMLReader.java:152)
at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:345)
at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:143)
at org.codehaus.swizzle.jira.JiraRss.<init>(JiraRss.java:63)
at org.codehaus.swizzle.jira.JiraRss.<init>(JiraRss.java:53)
at org.codehaus.swizzle.jira.JiraRss.<init>(JiraRss.java:49)
at com.lehman.jira.nugget.viewFilterServlet.printJiraIssues(viewFilterServlet.java:219)
at com.lehman.jira.nugget.viewFilterServlet.doGet(viewFilterServlet.java:156)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:740)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl$ServletInvocationAction.run(ServletStubImpl.java:1077)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:465)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:348)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext$ServletInvocationAction.run(WebAppServletContext.java:7047)
at weblogic.security.acl.internal.AuthenticatedSubject.doAs(AuthenticatedSubject.java:321)
at weblogic.security.service.SecurityManager.runAs(SecurityManager.java:121)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.invokeServlet(WebAppServletContext.java:3902)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletRequestImpl.execute(ServletRequestImpl.java:2773)
at weblogic.kernel.ExecuteThread.execute(ExecuteThread.java:224)
at weblogic.kernel.ExecuteThread.run(ExecuteThread.java:183)
fields.summary: RSS subscriptions non-SAX compliant - Character reference "&#1a" is an invalid XML character.

fields.description:
Need to update:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/splitting.html

The document should mention that when splitting a JIRA instance there are 2 things to worry about:
# data
# attachments

The doc already covers data, but needs to talk about attachments.

JIRA keeps attachments on the file system. When splitting instances, the attachment directory will need to be duplicated. After restoring the data on the second JIRA instance, need to login as admin user and repoint the second instance of JIRA at the copy of the attachment directory.

When projects are deleted from an instance of JIRA, the relevant attachments (i.e. attachments that belong to issues for projects that are being deleted) will be removed.
fields.summary: Update splitting JIRA instances doc to mention attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12505].
  {panel}

Hello,

When an issue is moved to a project to which the Reporter (or watcher) does not have permissions, the move notification is not delivered to him. I can understand that a person is not notified on the projects to which he doesn't have permissions, but he should at least be notified of the move - otherwise he doesn't even have a clue to what happened.
Can something be done about that?

Kind Regards,
Aleksey
fields.summary: Notification not sent when issue moved to a project to which the user has no permissions
Limited Browse Users permisson

fields.description:
If I enter a comment that contains a URL enclosed in <tag></tag>, the closing '<' is subsequently treated as part of the URL.  

The closing '<' should be recognized as a non-URL punctuation character, marking the end of the URL.

Here's a similar example: these two URLs should be identical:
http://yahoo.com
<tag>http://yahoo.com</tag>

This a a clone of 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2598 
URL parser doesn't stop at >
fields.summary: URL parser doesn't stop at <

fields.description: See  JRA-12493 for details. Need to ensure that we mention that system properties override the server settings.
fields.summary: Update the mail documentation to mention that system properties override mail server settings
Linking Priority to Due date

fields.description:
Hello Atlassians,

I am facing the problem, that I need to get some information of issues via soap.

The information i need to get are:

- Issue links (this issue links to some other issues)
- Original Estimate
- Remaining Estimate
- Time spent

is it planned to be implement these functions for the SOAP Api? It is quite urgent to know, if we can go this way or need to do something else to get to these information.

the other way would be logging into the jira system via a script (https ) and parse the html source code ... but this would be very inelegant :)

I would be glad to get a response.

Best regards
fields.summary: New functions for SOAP API

fields.description: The percentage values are shown as integers, but are calculated using truncate, which means the sum of the percentage values almost never add up to 100%. A value of "1.9xxxxxxx" is presented as 1% instead of 2% which would be a more correct value.
fields.summary: The percentage in the "Pie Chart Report" is calculated using truncate instead of round.

fields.description:
Work Description update does not maintain carriage returns, leading to some ugly emails.  Note, this applies to HTML emails.

However, the Issue Description, lower down in the same email, does maintain the new-lines.
fields.summary: Work Description on Work Logged Notification Email do not preserve carriage returns

fields.description:
When running the "Check workflow current step entries" integrity check (WorkflowCurrentStepCheck) a cache is kept around for project-issuetype-status to current step id mapping to speed up the check.

The problem is that the cache is never flushed, so if a project has been migrated to a different workflow scheme (and hence different workflows) the integrity checker starts falsely detecting errors. If the integrity checker is told to fix errors it corrupts the data, such that issues actually end up on the wrong workflow step. When this happens the issue shows the correct status, but the available workflow actions are wrong.

The current solution is to stop and start JIRA. Then run the integrity checker again to actaully fix the problems. Then restart JIRA again to clear the cache.
fields.summary: Caching in integrity checker can make integrity checker corrupt workflow data

fields.description:
We have both JIRA and Confluence running on the same host, though on different ports.  I use both regularly, in different tabs within Firefox.  We upgraded both recently (JIRA to Professional Edition, Version: 3.7.4-#189, Confluence to Version: 2.3.3 Build:#645), and since then, I've noticed the following behavior:  If I have a search/filter selected in JIRA, it gets lost by navigating to a new page in Confluence.  This does not happen if I'm navigating issues on an external JIRA issue list, such as Atlassian's, but only for the issue navigator in our local instance of JIRA.  One of our developers suggested that maybe JIRA and Confluence cookies use host name but not port number for uniqueness, and the cookie JIRA is using to track the selected search/filter gets overwritten by navigating in Confluence.

Specifics:
(1) In one tab, I run a JIRA seach that generates several pages of issues.  The URL is http://hostname:8088/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?pager/start=20 
(2) In another tab, where Confluence is up (e.g. http://hostname:8080/dashboard.action), I navigate to different page.
(3) Back in the JIRA tab, I click on page 2 or Next in the Issue Navigator.  This displays an empty list of issues with the message "You do not currently have a search or filter selected."

This is quite annoying, as I have to rerun my search every time I change the display in Confluence.
fields.summary: JIRA search/filter request lost by navigating in Confluence, in another browser tab
Automatically create links for issues that have moved project

fields.description:
Hi, 

since JIRA 3.8 the new permissions to edit own and all comments are available. 

We create all projects and their permission schemes via jelly scripts. When creating a permission scheme there is no jelly tag for editing own / all comments. At least I can't find it in the documentation....
It is really a lot of stupid work to add all groups afterwards to the permission "edit own comments" in every permission scheme, when you have five groups per project and you just created 10 projects ;)

Cheers,
Irene
fields.summary: Need to document Jelly: Tag for creating permission "edit own comments" and "edit all comments" is missing
The local help should be specific to a project

fields.description: Some i18n keys related to "edit comment" screen are missing from language_default.jar properties file. Please see attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Missing i18n keys for "edit comments" feature

fields.description:
Hi,

To begin I am sorry for my english, but I am french.

It is possible to hide fields following the group ? 
For example : I create a group ABC. When a user of his group create an Issue I don't want that the field 'Component' displays however, if it is a member of Developers group, I want that this field is available.

Which version I need if I want that groups and users are independant for every project ?

How can I do this ? Maybe it is only possible with an other version, but which version ? Professionnal ? Enterprise ?
fields.summary: Dashboard, Screen following the group.

fields.description:
I am interested in having a custom field which its UI emulates the behavior of the Attachment field. It's better to have that as it is more organized than typing in a big blank box (infinite text). Can you have one of that?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Click and Append Fields

fields.description:
It's a good thing that I have a portlet that allows me to show my filter, which shows the first 20 records set. 
The point here, is I am wondering whether is it possible of instead going to the filter page, that I can have a button, when I click shows the next 20 (depending on value set) records and so on. 

In otherwords, page scrolling within that portlet.
fields.summary: Scrolling Issues In One Portlet Page

http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/14518/SearchRequest-14518.xml&tempMax=1000

Note the '&' being used to separate the parameter -- this should be a '?'
fields.summary: When viewing a saved filter, the 'Current View' links are incorect

fields.description:
Quoting the error description:
{quote}
I can confirm that the cvs components of JIRA do indirectly attempt close the logs, resulting in a close of System.err, which, due to tomcat invocation redirection, is the same as stdout. I have attached a wrapping Stream to stderr that dumps a stacktrace whenever someone attempts to close it. Here is it's output (there are plenty of those at JIRA startup):
{noformat}
java.lang.Exception: Someone tried to close the stream System.err
        at be.rmi.intranet.tomcat.IOGuardianListener$GuardedStream.close(IOGuardianListener.java:95)
        at org.apache.jasper.util.SystemLogHandler.close(SystemLogHandler.java:123)
        at org.apache.jasper.util.SystemLogHandler.close(SystemLogHandler.java:123)
        at org.apache.jasper.util.SystemLogHandler.close(SystemLogHandler.java:123)
        at com.jcraft.jsch.IO.close(Unknown Source)
        at com.jcraft.jsch.Channel.disconnect(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.connection.ExtConnection.close(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.updateCvs(CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.java:427)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.updateCvs(CvsRepository.java:232)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.updateRepository(CvsRepository.java:287)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.DefaultRepositoryManager.updateRepository(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:547)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.DefaultRepositoryManager.updateRepositories(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:500)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.vcs.VcsService.run(VcsService.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
{noformat}

Here is, basically, the code used to 'guard' System.err stream:
{noformat}
PrintStream err = System.err;
err.flush();
System.setErr(new GuardedStream(err,"System.err"));
{noformat}
GuardedStream follows simply the delegation pattern, except for close() where it refuses the close() operation and dumps a stacktrace to stdout.
{quote}
fields.summary: CVS module of JIRA closes STDOUT
OrderableField.getViewHTML on renderable customfields does not use passed issues value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12478].
  {panel}

I'd like to see some improvements on how email notifications are sent. There are a few problems with it at the moment:

- As a non-admin, I can only configure a limited amount of email notifications myself, i.e. watches and scheduled filter reports. If I want to watch for all activity on a project (for example) I can't - the server admin has to.

- Event based email notifications should ideally be more fine grained. As an example, say some users want to know about all new issues of a certain component as soon as they are created, but not the whole project. As far as I can tell, that's not possible right now - you either get notified of all new issues for a project or none at all.

Basically, I think the ideal case is that users should be able to set up email events based on filters, i.e. like the scheduled email, but whenever there's a change, rather than after a schedule. And when this email is sent, it's the update, not the entire filter list.

I'd be keen to see this go in so please feel free to throw ideas at me!
fields.summary: Email sending improvements

fields.description:
Issue Type schemes can't currently be renamed (Issue type *screen* schemes can, but not Issue Type schemes).

In some ways this could be considered a bug since it says that an issue scheme can be renamed when you create a new one through the 'Project' part of the Admin screens.
fields.summary: Be able to rename Issue Type Schemes

fields.description:
When a user clicks on the Attach File operation, there should also be a comment automatically added with a link to that attachment. And if the user adds a comment at the same time as attaching, the link should also be automatically created beneath the user's comment.

Also, the manage attachments grid should also be shown on the issue view page, for a better overview of all attachments.
fields.summary: Add ability to comment and auto-link to attachment when using Attach File operation

fields.description:
I've just noticed that the UserPicker isn't availble to project admins when involved in project user management. The workaround is to make a project-admin group and add this to the global Browse Users permissions. Assigning Project Roles (Administrator) to this global permission would be much easier.

Thanks ..........Geoff
fields.summary: Allow role selection for some global permissions - Browse Users

fields.description:
The FileService will not successfully delete a file under windows because it leaves a FileInputStream open when trying to delete the file. This should work under linux but will not work under windows. The simple solution is to close the file input stream before we try to delete the file.

This was found by https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-11222, thanks to Thomas Poersch
fields.summary: FileService does not delete files under windows

fields.description:
The Multi Issue Key Searcher field currently requires commas between issues to work properly. The best solution is to be more flexible (specifically, allow simple whitespace). However, documenting this requirement in the description below this field would at least mitigate the problem.

The existing descriptive text reads:
"Multi Issue Key Searcher - allows you to enter multiple issues for searching."

You should modify this to say:
"Multi Issue Key Searcher - allows you to enter multiple issues for searching.  Separate issue keys with commas. "
fields.summary: Multi Issue Key Searcher should allow whitespace as issue key separator (or at least modify the descriptive text)
Improving UrlRewrite to better handle HTTP request parameters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12468].
  {panel}

Create a new search
Enter 2 keys into the Multi Issue Key Searcher (as shown in Screen shot)
click View
This returns the 2 issues
Click Permlink -- the permlink will not contain a reference to the keys. 

This is an example of the permlink generated.

https://jira.polycom.com:8443/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC 

Normally, a permlink will contain the search criteria so that the search can be re-executed.

https://jira.polycom.com:8443/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&reporterSelect=issue_current_user&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC
fields.summary: Permlink for Multi Issue Key Searcher field should contain values of issue keys

fields.description:
It is possible for an e-mail to create an infinite loop if JIRA picks up its own sent email. 

There are a few ways this can occur, but one example is if JIRA checks a box called helpdesk@atlassian.com and an e-mail is sent with the following headers:
{noformat}
To: <helpdesk@atlassian.com>
From: "Viagra.com" <helpdesk@atlassian.com>
{noformat}
then JIRA will send an e-mail back to helpdesk@atlassian.com once the issue is created.  It will pickup this e-mail again, and start an infinite loop of creating comments and sending e-mails for this particular issue.  

The email handlers in JIRA should be smart enough to check the from address to make sure it isn't the same as the to address.
fields.summary: MailHandlers may create an infinite loop if the monitored mailbox receives notifications from the same instance of JIRA

fields.description:
Scenario:
1. Prepare a custom filter.
2. Change default column selection and order.
3. Start Bulk Change.

Issue: During Bulk Change, Jira does not show pre-selected columns. The column order is also different.   It should display columns in the same order as configured in the filter.
fields.summary: Bulk Change should preserve configured columns

fields.description:
Allow fields of type Select and Multi Select to have a description value next to each Option.

For example, field Keywords is Multi Select. Options are A, B, C.  We would like to have descriptions next to the options.  Hence,

Keywords
A   (this is the description for A)
B  (this is the description for B)
C  (this is the description for C)

The descriptions should be visible when the values are picked but should not be stored in the database.
fields.summary: Allow fields of type Select and Multi Select to have a description value next to each Option

fields.description:
You cannot select users from multiple pages of a Multi User Picker field.  

1. Click the people icon to pop up the name picker.
2. Put a checkmark next to any name.
3. Goto page 2.
4. Put a checkmark next to another name.
5. Click "Select"

Expected result, each user that I have placed a checkmark next to is added to the notify box. 
Actual result, only the user(s) on the last page I viewed before clicking "Select" are added. 

This means to add multiple people, I would need to open the picker box several times in order to repeat for every page-worth of people.  This should be changed so that you can select multiple users from multiple pages.
fields.summary: Modify Multi User Picker so you can select users across multiple pages
Apache integration

fields.description:
mention that you need to DELETE this line:

schema-name="PUBLIC"

(cf. other db docs)
fields.summary: SQL Server: mention in the code example that you need to delete this line: schema-name="PUBLIC"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12460].
  {panel}

GLOSSARY TERMS:

(please feel free to add to this list)

Bulk operation
Condition
Dashboard
Filter
Gadget
Global Permission
Issue
Issue operation
Issue security level (Issue permission)
Permission
Priority
Project
Project Permission
Project Role
Resolution
Role
Scheme
Screen scheme
Status
Step
Sub-task
Transition
Workflow


(NB. remember to wrap the actual definition inside the {excerpt} macro, so that additional info can be added that won't be displayed via the {include}/{excerpt-include} macro)
fields.summary: create Glossary; and create Index (using labels)

fields.description: Currently you can only watch a singgle issue at a time. I would like a new feature that allows a user to assign themselves as a watcher of multiple issues (all at the same time).
fields.summary: Allow for multiple issues to be watched at the same time

fields.description:
_emphasized text_Similar to JRA-12410 - deleting a custom field does not adequately clean up after itself. Specifically, affected issues are not reindexed so the updated security and permission aspects are not reflected in search results which is a security hole. Note that a naive fix may produce performance problems since there may be a large number of affected issues which must be reindexed. Consider the index lock granularity in fixing this - it may be better to reindex the issues one at a time so the fine grained lock does not cause latency problems for concurrent users.

Also - has this always been the case? Surely no! - bug fixer should investigate this - has this bug been introduced in the last, say, 12 months?
fields.summary: Deleting a custom field which has an issue security scheme or permission scheme on it does not update the index and issue navigator is out of date

fields.description: The feature we acquire is to independently export and import Jira _configuration_ (e.g. workflows, screens, permissions) separate from the _data_ (the issues). For instance when running Jira Professional in a test- and in a production environment, both activated with the same workflow. It would be nice if changes are made to the workflow in the _test_ environment, to later "apply" these changes to the workflow in the _production_ environment by exporting and importing the workflow including all its dependencies (e.g. statuses, transition screens, etc).
fields.summary: Separate export/import of configuration and data

fields.description:
When creating a project from CSV wizard the project key is not validated agains the regexp defined in jira.projectkey.pattern in jira-application.properties.

Once you have a project with an invalid key all sorts of things go wrong (such as being unable to browse issues in the project).

The CSV ConfigureCsvMapping needs to validate the project key to stop this from happening.
fields.summary: When creating a project from CSV wizard the project key is not validated agains the regexp defined in jira.projectkey.pattern in jira-application.properties

fields.description:
When a JIRA instance is used to create a Support Request from the Support Request page, and the resulting email is processed by the CreateSupportRequestHandler at https://support.atlassian.com the reporter is set to the user from the email's FROM address. This is set for the SMTP server properties, and is not the email address sent in the body of the email as the Contact for the support request.

There are two things that need to be fixed:
1. Fix the CreateSupportRequestHandler to look for a user based on the REPLY-TO header, OR the Contact Info portion of the email OR the TO header (in that order)
2. Fix the JIRA Support Request to use the Contact Info section to set the REPLY-TO header in the sent support request email.

The combination of these two will preserve backward compatibility for old versions of JIRA.

Please see [this issue|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-11217] for confirmation of the behaviour.
fields.summary: JIRA internal support requests are not being assigned the Reporter who is the contact for the Support Request
Add ability to search by Comments recently changed or added within a certain timeframe
Single Group by Report should be able to display formatted comments created within a certain timeframe
Single Group by Report only works for Saved Filters - It would be nice to make a report from the Issue Navigator cache

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12439].
  {panel}

We use the lastest version of Jira. We currently use one project as our development project and others to support the cycle of issue management and suggestions. I need to be able to assign project lead and project team members as roles to each 'version' as in essence the versions are sub-projects. I can't find anything immediately logged for this. 

# Can you advise what I could do? 
# Or could this functionality be added? 

Thanks. Annastashia
fields.summary: Ability to assign project lead and project team members to versions

fields.description: When you try to update to a new Japanese edition of JIRA with a commercial/academic license key with expired maintenance, the page you see after inserting your license key is not internationalised.
fields.summary: License Key Error Page not internationalized
Web Fragment Conditions cannot depend on custom component plugins

fields.description:
It would be very helpful if another field was created - with is only visible by authorized groups - with a name such as "Issues created by User" ,"Related Issues" or "Outstanding Issues created by Reporter" that will display all the current issues created by a Reporter that are still Open/Outstanding.

The field could be hidden to all except permitted groups; for instance only visible by "atlassian-staff".

It is useful to keep track of all issues created by users that require assistance from different parties and boost awareness between the parties involved.
fields.summary: Field for displaying issues currently opened by the same Reporter

fields.description:
It seems like some API docs available in the documentation are broken:

* http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/api.html
fields.summary: API Docs missing

fields.description:
We would like to be able to "weight" or possibly allow multiple votes.

I have to admit that I'm really not too sure of the best way to do this, and I think it should be considered alongside a couple of other voting requests I've found.  Voting is great because it can very clearly tell the developers what the users are most interested in seeing.  But for the voter, there is no way to prioritise or weight their vote.

For example, I've currently voted on 7 improvements my site would like to see.  In my mind, there is a very clear order in them.  We have 
1 preventing the wider use of Jira within our organisation.
2 that projects are screaming for and I've had to bodge round
3 that would make life easier for a significant number of users
1 that is nice-to-have, but we'd much rather have Atlassian look at the others.

My idea would be to allow each user a level of weighting on their votes, so that they can emphasise what is important to them.  It goes something like:

1) Each voter has one Gold vote, two Silver, and as many Bronze votes as they want.  They can still only vote once per issue.
2) When the "number of votes" is calculated for an issue, a Gold vote would be counted thrice, and a Silver twice.

I suspect it would be a good idea to limit the Bronzes as well (e.g. "you may not vote on more than 10% of open issues").  And it would need a method of "when issue is fixed, release votes back to users".  

One pitfall - it could get horribly complicated when you consider sites like mine - in London, we've got 4 commercial Jira instances (with another one on the way), of which I look after three.  I have a feeling that we are using it on other sites (especially in Oz).  There's an argument there for allowing me 3 Gold and 6 Silvers.  To be honest, it's not a problem here, because the licenses are in different names, so each "owner" would get their own votes.  The three of us agree on the priorities, so we would vote the same anyway.  But that might not be the case elsewhere.
fields.summary: Weighted Voting
Create user preference which allows watchers of a parent issue to automatically watch of all the sub-tasks

fields.description:
Steps: 
try to open 
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?pid=10240&query=%2Ba+%2B-+%2Bb&summary=true&description=true&body=true&environment=true&view=rss&decorator=none&start=0&mode=hide&tempMax=25&reset=true&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC

Expected: 
search result or user-level error

Observed: 
system error
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException: org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException: Encountered "-" at line 1, column 4.

Evaluation:
The problem is caused by "+-" part ofo the search request. It is handled correctly by html view.
fields.summary: System error caused by unparseable search request to XML view
Make anonymiser more strict about the translation of values

fields.description:
We have to use an extra worktime-repoting Tool. 
This tool can produce csv-files (we can do xml from csv :-)) with Issue-Key, User, and amount-of-time spent, date/time start working and date/time end-working (and a lot of others to).

It would be much greater, quicker an less errorous to import these data instead of enter them manually a second time for each ISSUE in JIRA.


.. or it would even be easyer to enter them in a table and "SAVE" several line at once, instead of search each issue individual, and add the  Log work done  seperate. ( compare to JRA-5034 )
fields.summary: Import Time-Tracking data from external TimeReporting System (CSV?, XML?)

fields.description: In order to enable best practices during each transition of an issue, I want to require a comment.  I have installed the workflow required field that's available under plugins web page, however, comments is not in the list of available fields to require during transition.
fields.summary: Need to require comment on transition

fields.description: Our setup has hundereds of the projects, many of which use the same workflow.  When a workflow change is needed it very time consuming to unassociate the workflow from each project in order to make the workflow change.  We would like the ability to bulk edit projects to speed up this process.
fields.summary: Need bulk edit of projects
Sort by more than three columns in the Issue Navigator - Sort precedence interface

fields.description:
Sometimes we need to view several issues at a time, but the list will can't be generated using a filter. It is manually generated by users, using different criteria, but they provide us only with a list of issues. For instance, JRA-1604, JRA-1606, JRA-1608, JRA-1603. if the user provides us with this type of list we must enter manually each issue in quick search filed. It  would be great if all the list could be used in quick search field, providing all the results in a list, just as with the filters.

Regards,
Vlad
fields.summary: We should have the posibility to use quick search for a list of issues.

fields.description: The EagerLoadingOfbizCustomFieldPersister is storing an Issue's custom field values in a ThreadLocal so a request may access the same values in a timely manner if requested again. Unfortunately a reindex all process touches every issue, slowly building these caches up and not releasing until either the reindex thread pool is discarded and the threads die or an OutOfMemoryError occurs. We should really SoftReference the list of values.
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError during reindex all (due to EagerLoadingOfbizCustomFieldPersister's caching of custom field values)

fields.description: A custom field with an issue security scheme based on it is deleted. A subsequent search on a issue under this security scheme causes a system error.
fields.summary: Deleting a custom field which has an issue security scheme or permission scheme on it causes system error

fields.description:
The "Attach Another File" link on the issue Attachment Manager page is only displayed if the user has the EDIT_ISSUE permission. We should change this to use the CREATE_ATTACHMENT permission instead.

See ManageAttachments.isAttachable()
fields.summary: Attach Another File link on Attachment Manager page is associated with the EDIT_ISSUE permission

fields.description:
Currently importing data with attachments fails against the Bugzilla 2.22.2 database due to a schema change in that version.

From [the forums|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=16538]:

{panel}

I am trying to use Bugzilla importer provided by Jira to import all the bugs in Bugzilla 2.22 (and 2.22.2) into Jira 3.7.4. However, I have found out that the attachments will not be migrated into Jira and I have gotten the following errors:

[21:09:36] Importing Issue: "test with attachment"
[21:09:37] Error on importing attachments for bug 8. Error:Column 'thedata' not found.

After searching a little bit more, I have found that the database schema of Bugzilla has been changed since 2.21.1. In Bugzilla 2.21.1, a new table named attach_data was introduced to handle big attachment. However, the Bugzilla importer for Jira 3.7.4 (even 3.8) is still using the schema for Bugzilla 1.8.

Here comes my question:

Is there anybody who has a fix for this? If so, could you please share your fix(es) with me?
{panel}
fields.summary: CLONE -JIRA BugzillaImporter needs to be made compatible with Bugzilla 2.22.2

fields.description: The "Manage Attachments" page shows up "Attach another Screenshot" link eventhough the "Attach screenshot to this issue" operation is turned off (via Administration -> Systems -> Plugins)
fields.summary: "Manage attachments" not issue-operation-aware (attach screenshot)

fields.description:
When we try to add a watcher and select the icon on the right side for selection...
we see the  java script to be called is     openwindow('userNames")
but we get "java error on page" and do not see the list

recently upgraded from 3.5 to 3.8   Enterprise
fields.summary: Add Watcher generates java script "error on page"
Need ability to see change history of edited comments

fields.description:
When using russian indexing JIRA not search for numbers in text fields with numbers (Text search module in Navigator) and custom fields with Free Text Searcher.

In "other" language and English - search for numbers fine, but with wrong Russian search.

I.e. search for code in information or in custom field for card number (i.e. search for "4013*" returns 0 records even if exist record with value "40135083")

h3. Workaround

* Go to General Configuration and set the indexing language to "Other"
fields.summary: Search for numbers in text fields return no results when indexing in russian

fields.description:
We recently upgraded from JIRA 3.6.3 to JIRA 3.8.  A user reported a problem when trying to add watchers to a JIRA using Internet Explorer version 7.0.5730.11.  Clicking on the icon that allows you to select users from a list (mouse over shows "watcher.manager.picker.title" and information bar at bottom of IE window displays javascript:openWindow('userNames') ) resulted in an error.

Clicking on the "Error on Page" in the information bar in the IE window shows these details:
Line: 618
Char: 9
Error: Invalid Argument
Code: 0
URL: <our installation URL>/secure/ManageWatchers!default.jspa:id=17406

The problem does not exist with the Firefox browser.
fields.summary: Clicking on user prompt in Manage Watch List in Internet Explorer 7.0.5730.11 results in an error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12397].
  {panel}

The subscription to a filter is a great feature. A possible improvement could be to send the email notification ONLY if the filter content has changed. A kind of "diff". It will avoid spam, and be more efficient for recipient.
I don't know how to do this today, so I guess it should be classified as an improvement request, ... if that feature is already available, please let me know how can I use it !

thanks in advance. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Filter Subscription - Notify only when changes appeared

fields.description:
I'm importing a set of new features. Each feature has a corresponding estimate. As part of
the import, the remaining estimate gets set to "Unknown". When a user begins logging time spent
on this feature, JIRA is not able to auto adjust the remaining estimate (presumably because
it can't subtract from "Unknown").

As a work around, the user must set the estimated time remaining correctly the first time 
they log time spent on this feature. Once the remaining estimate is a number, the auto adjust
works as it should.

An improvement would be to set the remaining estimate to be the same as the original 
estimate when the import is performed.
fields.summary: Import of features - remaining estimate should default to the original estimate
